recipe.title: Syrian Za'atar
recipe.description: Za'atar is a kind of Middle Eastern pesto made with wild thyme which grows in the mountains and sesame seeds. In some villages they also add marjoram and a few pinches of crushed sumac - a slightly sour crimson berry which adds a tart, lemony flavour.

directions.step: Make the za'atar by placing the sesame seeds in a dry frying pan on low heat. Toast for 4-5 minutes or until lightly golden. Place the seeds in a mortar and pestle and coarsely grind. Add the herbs and salt and grind to a paste. Stir in the sumac and olive oil.
Za'atar is delicious sprinkled on toasted pita bread, stirred through couscous or drizzled on roast pumpkin or cauliflower.
